abstract: Pres Obama's top security officials persuade him to retain option of first use of nuclear strike during confrontation, which he had considered dropping; argue abandoning option would estrange allies and embolden enemies; decision undermines Obama's pledge to work for reduction of world's nuclear weapons.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD

lead_paragraph: Aides have told the president that such a guarantee would undermine allies and embolden Russia and China.

headline.main: Obama Unlikely to Vow No First Use of Nuclear Weapons
headline.print_headline: Obama Unlikely to Drop Option of First Strike
